alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 4:44PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover and eastern Brunswick Counties through 530 PM EST... At 442 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of showers in the vicinity of Bolivia and Mill Creek, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, South Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, Figure Eight Island, North Masonboro Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, Bishop, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Myrtle Grove, Murrayville, Masonboro, Castle Hayne, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Ogden and Winnabow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 414 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 27 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
